data.title: A Little Shakespeare: Love's Labour's Lost
data.text:
JUSON WILLIAMS (Associate Director / Choreographer) couldn’t be more excited to bring Shakespeare’s LLL to life at Two River Theater! A four-time Audelco Award Winner, an M.I.T Award Winner, and a Broadway World Award Recipient. His directing credits include: Slow Dance On The Killing Ground, Radium Girls, Positive! Juson’s Director/Choreography credits include: For The Love Of Charlie Brown (Vanguard Theatre Company), The Wiz (St John’s University), Grease (WB’s European Tour), Smokey Joe’s Cafe, Jesus Christ Superstar (Westchester Broadway Theatre). He is Owner and Artistic Director of the famed choir JW’s Inspirational Singers. They have appeared on Season 16 of “A.G.T,” “The 60th Annual Grammy Awards” with Sam Smith, “The Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade” and “The Rockefeller Tree Lighting.” Juson is developing and bringing new works to life, in which he also penned, his upcoming work: A Night with Sarah Vaughan, Ella’s Jukebox Cafe, and Picture Incomplete, his special piece, sure to be a Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award winning musical. Stay tuned!

JESSICA PARKS (she/her) has been working as a scenic designer for theater since 2003, and has been the resident scenic designer and prop designer for the New Jersey Repertory Company since 2010. She has worked as the prop supervisor for the Little Shakes program in the past and is very excited to have the opportunity to work with this wonderful program as a designer. Set designs in NYC include: Michael Tucker’s Fern Hill, Butler, The Housewives of Mannheim, Jericho and Poetic License at 59E59 St. Theaters. This is Not a Time for Peace, The End of Hester and Dan Lauria’s Dinner with the Boys at Theater Row on 42nd St. Other designs include: A Tailor Near Me, The Hummingbirds, Eden Prairie 1971, Memoirs of a Forgotten Man, Wolf at the Door, The Jag, Swimming at the Ritz, Happy and Broomstick at the New Jersey Repertory Company in Long Branch.

Summer Hipper (Costume Assistant) is a Junior at East Brunswick Magnet School in the Arts Technology Program. Her credits include Winter Dance Show 2023 (Lighting Design/ Light Board Operator), Night of Restoration (Costume Design/Wardrobe), 10 Ways to Survive a Zombie Apocalypse (Costume Design/Light Board Operator), 8th Reel Film Festival (Lighting Designer/Light Board Operator), Winter Music Show 2023(Lighting Design/Light Board Operator). This is her first show at Two River Theater and she is so excited to be a part of it. She is also a 2023/24 Howard Aronson Metro Scholar. She would like to thank her teacher and mentor Ms. Anello for teaching her everything she knows. She would also like to thank her mother for supporting her through everything.

Kate Cordaro (she/her) is a silver curly-headed earth mother, theater artist and administrator, baking enthusiast, and dog lover who currently has two cats. She is the Director of Education for Two River Theater in Red Bank, NJ, recognized by USA Today as one of the top ten regional theaters in the nation. Since 2004, Kate has built the education department from the ground up, and under her guidance TRT has become a recognized artistic home for thousands of students through programs like A Little Shakespeare, Howard Aronson Metro Scholars, Summer Intensives, a vibrant student matinee series, as well as 16 original plays and musicals created and performed by student ensembles. In 2022, the A Little Shakespeare program was featured on the PBS docuseries Here’s the Story, chronicling the theatrical creation process from auditions to closing night. She has served on TRT’s Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Committee since 2017, and works to support safe spaces as a commitment to creating inclusive environments in which all students at Two River Theater can do their best work. Her favorite directing projects for young people include Bridge to Terabithia, Narnia, Charlotte’s Web (all at Play Group Theatre in White Plains, NY) as well as Alice, Eat the Taste, four installments of The Heroes Project, Neverland and Middle School Mysteries through the education department at TRT. Kate is a frequent Drama and Musical Theater Adjudicator for the Monmouth County, Ocean County, and NJ State Teen Arts Festivals. She is the recipient of multiple awards through the New Jersey Theatre Alliance and Monmouth Arts, and was featured in the latter’s recent 50 for 50 Photo Project highlighting individuals who are influential in moving Monmouth County toward a more inspired, inclusive, and creative arts community. She received the 2023 NJ Governor’s Award for Distinguished Service in Theatre Education and Arts Administration. Born and raised in Pittsburgh, Kate moved to New York to study at the Stella Adler Conservatory and Musical Theater Works through NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. Selected roles include Lady Anne in Richard III, Audrey in Little Shop of Horrors, Dorine in Tartuffe, Frauline Doktor Mathilde Von Zahnd in The Physicists at Soho Rep, and Yara in Atom and Eve (dir. Ken Page). Kate also was featured in Janeane Garofalo’s short film Housekeeping, which premiered at the New York Comedy Film Festival. Kate is crazy in love with Kevin and Marcus Camoosa.
